zone.line: Henceforth the fields of Heaven-reflecting sea
Which are my realm, will heave, unstain'd with
Beneath the uplifting winds—like plains of corn
Swayed by the summer air; my streams will flow
Fortunate isles; & from their glassy thrones
Blue Proteus & his humid Nymphs shall mark
The shadow of fair ships, as mortals see
The floating bark of the un light laden moon 110
With that white star, which is its unseen sightless pilots cast
Borne down the rapid sunsets ebbing sea ;
Tracking their path no more by blood & groans
And desolation, and the mingled voice
Of slavery & command—but by the light115
Of wave-reflected flowers, and floating odours sweet ,
And music soft, & mild frank free gentle voices
That sweetest music,—such as spirits love.
